text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

When I think about the question,
'What is my life's purpose?', I

steal a quote from the baseball
player Jackie Robinson,

who said that "A life
is not important,

except in the impact
it has on other lives."

And I think about
that personally

through two different contexts,
both the personal context
and the professional context.

Personally, I want to be
the best husband, brother,

potentially father, son,
friend that I can be.

Professionally, I
fundamentally believe

that business can be
used as a force for good.

Given my background, I
believe that that value

can be delivered to society
through sustainable supply

chains, both environmentally
sustainable and socially
sustainable.

And so for me, again
hearkening back to,

what does impact look like
on the lives of others?

For me, that looks like
sustainable supply chains,

especially in
developing economies.
